heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 08 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (193°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.3°C), outside temperature (down 9.3°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 380 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 10.8°C), cloud levels (up 362 m), and inside temperature (up 4.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 380.2m lower than yesterday, 250.3m lower than the past week, 361.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 993m to 2630m and averaged 1242.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; icy, freezing temperatures. Also, near calm conditions. Possible light showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and the light is absent. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.1°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
